list_definition.mean_english: nhóm người đứng gác không cho ai vào làm khi đình công
list_definition.definition: (any one of) a number of people employed at a factory etc who are on strike and who try to persuade workers not to go to work there, not to deliver goods there etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The men set up a picket to stop lorries/trucks getting into the factory

list_definition.mean_english: nhóm cảnh sát làm nhiệm vụ
list_definition.definition: a soldier or a small group of soldiers on special duty, usually to guard against a sudden attack by the enemy

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The commander placed pickets at various points round the camp
In this country, strikers have the legal right to picket

list_definition.definition: to place a group of soldiers, strikers etc somewhere as a picket

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The strikers’ leaders decided to picket the factory

list_ex_of_english: In so far as a guideline of six pickets is given, that is a commonsense guideline to anyone who may contemplate taking part in picketing.
We must brace ourselves and be much tougher in implementing the law concerning pickets.
Special coaches and buses are conveying the flying pickets to their destinations.
The ordinary hours of the civil guard, which have not been changed, are much shorter than those of the pickets.
Pickets are in attendance throughout the coalfields in an attempt to deter those seeking to go to work.
We have heard much about intimidation on the part of the pickets.
We were asked how many pickets were going to each place.
Of course, if pickets go beyond that and break the law, then that is a matter for the police in the pat titular circumstances prevailing.
